column4: i am trying to create a folder that anyone in the www-data group can write to, when i create the folder it shows 'doug doug' which i assume means only i can write to it, when i want it to be 'doug www-data'
is there anyway to make that happen?
'chown doug:www-data /path/to/directory' then 'chmod 0770 /path/to/directory' or 0775 if you want it world readable.
thanks wylde, that worked.  is it possible for it always to write as the www-data group? we don't want to have to do this everytime we copy files over
cool, i'll read up on that
anything written in that directory should be available to anyone who can  read/modify/write files
i wrote a file with my user, and it says 'doug doug' for the user/group settings when i do ls -l, and then when another user tries to open it, nano says 'Warning: No write permission'
ahh I see, then I suppose you will need to add them to the www-data group
they are, when i run group 'username' it shows they are both in the www-data group
do i need to reboot the computer before the changes stick?
I suppose then, maybe www-data should own the directory. Then all users that need to write would be in the www-data group.
